subject: RE: [junit] JUnit and EJB! please help, a beginner
msgSnippet: ... To whom or what is your university local? ... [...] ... I would direct you back to the Cactus Web site, viz:
messageBody:
> From: james_khu [mailto:james_khu@...]
>
> I am a graduate student at a local university.

To whom or what is your university "local?"

> I was just given a research project on how to do both unit
> testing and load testing of EJB. They told me to explore the
> possibility of using JUnit to unit test EJB.
[...]
> Can any of you guys give a pointer on where is the best place to
> start looking for simple sample codes to run and play with ? I look
> into jakarta.cactus website, but they don;t offer step by step
> instructions on how to begin testing ejb. I don't even know how to
> pack EAR, WAR, or jar file.

I would direct you back to the Cactus Web site, viz:
http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/writing/howto_ejb.html

And read it more carefully, because the step by step instructions are there
in a link.

If you don't know how to pack a jar file, what are you doing in this
graduate course testing EJBs? Amazing! I would run down to the bookstore
and pick up a good book on J2EE development if I were you. Just look for
one that explains how to use the jar command to create EJB jar files. I
know there are similarly good free tutorials on the Internet. I would
recommend the Sun J2EE tutorials, but they tend to show how to do assembly
and deployment with their GUI tools, which won't teach you portable skills.

If you were on a job, I would say they gave the research project to the
*wrong guy*. How're you supposed to give a sound judgment as to whether
JUnit is suitable for unit testing EJBs if you don't even know how to "pack"
a jar file? Sorry, just trying to understand your position better and what
the motivations and pedagogical strategy of the teacher are.

Scott S.
